intro: Echidnopsis kohaitoensis, commonly known as the Kohaito starling plant, is a unique member of the Asparagaceae family native to New Zealand. It is a terrestrial herb characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and produces small, star-shaped flowers. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and lowland areas. Its foliage is typically a deep green, and it is known for its ornamental value in horticulture. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
